author: dimitry8570
content: https://github.com/ethereum/tests/releases/tag/v14.0

author: chfast
content: Are you interested in contribution some basic EVM tests to EEST?

author: chfast
content: E.g. for `MUL` or stack underflow for each opcode?

author: marioevz
content:
Yes by all means that would be great ðŸ˜„
We actually have a `ethereum/tests` -> `eest` porting procedure, where you add the tests that you ported in a PR to a file, and our CI will automatically run a coverage diff as an extra to guarantee that the tests at least have the same or better coverage. That plus a proper review can give us the guarantee that the test files in `ethereum/tests` can be considered legacy. <@393119312350543872> can comment a bit more on this process

author: chfast
content: We tried it for EOF migration and it said "coverage lost". I think we should try with something simpler first because there are no "successful" migrations yet.

author: marioevz
content: Definitely, I think a failure on this CI item should not block a PR from merging, but it would be nice to add it to the test porting file just to keep track of this
